Comment: Since we're talking about pipe dreams that'll never happen, we need to stop having "basis for impeachment" be the only way to get someone out of office. What we need to do is establish conditions under which the president, Supreme Court Justice, Senator, etc. where If they are found to do something illegal and convicted (which they should be able to be) they should immediately be removed from office without impeachment being necessary. It shouldn't take 2/3rds of Congress agreeing to kick the president out for the president to be able to be kicked out. Either they're guilty and they lose their job at the least or they're not and they keep their job.     At the very least, there should be impartial conditions under which someone like Trump has their ability to make executive orders frozen until they are tried and convicted when they commit a crime in office. When Trump breaks the law in the oval office in front of millions of people, it shouldn't take an impeachment proceeding to keep him from being able to rapid fire executive orders so fast the courts and Congress can't even address them all, like he's been doing.
